LISTENING EAR CRISIS CENTER
Dear Ms. Banks:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
February 13, 2023. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It
should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of
the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of
this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Melinda Gubbins, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12212 Personnel records
(2) The personnel record shall contain all of the following
information before employment may occur:
(b) Verification of education.
One of three employee files reviewed did not contain documentation that verification
of required education was obtained prior to hire.
R 400.12212 Personnel records
(2) The personnel record shall contain all of the following
information before employment may occur:
(h) Documentation from the department that the person has
not been named in a central registry case as the perpetrator of
child abuse or neglect in Michigan or in any state where the
person lived in the 5 years preceding hire.
One of three employee files reviewed contained documentation Central Registry (CR)
clearances were requested but there is not documentation the results were obtained
prior to hire as required.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
2/16/2022 INTERIM, CAP approved 3/11/2022
R 400.12312 Foster parent training
(4) At least 1 adult member of the household shall have
training in and maintain a current certification in first aid
from the American Heart Association or the American Red
Cross or other institution approved by the department.
One of three foster home files reviewed did not have current certification in first aid as
required.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional MDHHS Contract/Policy
requirements.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
• Upload all supporting licensing documents appropriately
• Develop pre-hire checklist to ensure all required documentation is obtained
prior to offer of employment.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
The agency did not request consultation.
EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted one acceptable corrective action plan in response to the
interim inspection completed on 2/16/2022 with a corrective action plan approved on
3/11/2022. During the review the agency had three violations. One citation was
noted a repeat violation in the current inspection. During the period under review the
agency did not report experiencing any challenges or barriers to achieve
compliance.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator reported the agency has continued to maintain the same
process as the previous review period and she feels as though they have been
successful. The Chief Administrator did not report experiencing any challenges or
barriers to achieve compliance.
Interviews
Interviews were conducted with two staff via telephone. Staff reported feeling
supported by supervision and coworkers. Staff reported no concerns or areas of
need.
Financial Overview
In reviewing the financial information provided, there is no concerns noted.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care and licensing services. All files were stored securely.
VI. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
